text.0: farshining widely famed going thy wonted way fed with the oil be helpful mitralike to us.
text.1: so viṣṇu een the wise must swell thy song of praise and he who hath oblations pay thee solemn rites.
text.2: he who brings gifts to him the ancient and the last to viṣṇu who ordains together with his spouse.
text.3: who tells the lofty birth of him the lofty one shall verily surpass in glory een his peer.
text.4: him have ye satisfied singers as well as ye know primeval germ of order even from his birth.
text.5: ye knowing een his name have told it forth may we viṣṇu enjoy the grace of thee the mighty one.
text.6: the sovran varuṇa and both the aśvins wait on this the will of him who guides the marut host.
text.7: viṣṇu hath power supreme and might that finds the day and with his friend unbars the stable of the kine.
text.8: even he the heavenly one who came for fellowship viṣṇu to indra godly to the godlier.
text.9: who maker throned in three worlds helps the Āryan man and gives the worshipper his share of holy law.
